entry.title: Iceland House
entry.content:
Iceland

The first (and so far only) time I went to Iceland was for a photography workshop. It was mostly an excuse to travel to somewhere interesting but it was also advantageous to have someone plan places for us to visit. We explored one of the western peninsulas and came across this house sitting out on the edge of a small lake. The backdrop of the hillly outcrop with the low clouds was absolutely stunning. Also interesting to note was how many awful photos before I took something that was half decent.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
Reply via email. I'd enjoy hearing from you.

entry.title: A Parisien Moment
entry.content:
Paris, France

It was my first time to Paris, near the beginning of what would be an exhausting cross-European trip to five different cities. I don't remember capturing this moment or remember whether this person was tired or distraught or exhausted. Whatever the case may be, I hope they are living their best life now.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
Reply via email. I'd enjoy hearing from you.

entry.title: Office Art
entry.content:
Ottawa, Canada

From Portland to Ottawa, from house to condo. This piece felt like a good fit for the office—my sanctuary. My condo is full of patterns and the horizontal and vertical lines of this piece, along with the warm colours, really lent themselves to this space. Now to have a seat, with a glass of whisky in hand, and enjoy some jazz.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
Reply via email. I'd enjoy hearing from you.

entry.title: Eye of the Bridge
entry.content:
Copenhagen, Denmark

Knippelsbro (aka Knippel Bridge) has quite the history. I found the perspective through the window of the bridge tower to be like an eye. I also adore the patina adding colour to it all.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
Reply via email. I'd enjoy hearing from you.

entry.title: Stockholm Train Station
entry.content:
Stockholm, Sweden

Notice the date on this photo? Yes, that's about two weeks before the first lockdown. We had just landed in Stockholm during a tour of restaurants. The train stations in Stockholm full of interesting details. I'd go back just to do a tour of train stations.

entry.title: Parliament of Canada
entry.content:
Ottawa, Canada

Ottawa is quite beautiful during the summer. Lots of luscious greens and blues. This was in 2021 when we were still heavily within a pandemic, so summer was very welcome.

entry.title: Greenville
entry.content:
Greenville, South Carolina

After watching shows about chef Sean Brock, I figured I'd take a trip down to Greenville to visit Husk. The city has its charm and I can see why many people I know choose to live here.

entry.title: Ceviche at Maido
entry.content:
Lima, Peru

Japan meets Peru in the best way. Maido was on the World's 50 Best Restaurants. The food was expertly prepared and absolutely delicious. My favourite was the 50 Hour Short Rib.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
Reply via email. I'd enjoy hearing from you.

entry.title: Cliffs of Faroe Islands
entry.content:
Trælanípan, Faroe Islands

It was a bit of a hike to get here. Much of the Faroe Islands haven't had many tourists.

As a result, there's not a clear path to get here. We got here and it was very windy. I was scared to get too close to the edge for fear of getting blown into the water.

 

Full photo metadata available on the site.
